Precautionary recommendations for patients with immunodeficiencies follow the national guidelines for the general population and include strict hygiene and social distancing measures to limit exposure. A general consensus has been reached to continue established therapies for the immune disorder, even immunosuppressive therapy for autoimmune complications of the underlying disease.
36 However, the current pandemic poses an exceptional challenge and safety concern for patients treated with cellular therapies, not only limited to the field of PID.
